column1: Aprelevka (Russian: Апре́левка) is a town in Naro-Fominsky District of Moscow Oblast
The town was named after the nearby Aprelevka River. While the name is quite similar to the Russian word "апрель" (April)
column2: it bears no etymological connection to it. Rather
column3: it is derived from the word "прель"

column1: Aprelevka was founded in 1899. It was granted urban-type settlement status in 1935 and the town status in 1961.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated within Naro-Fominsky District as the Town of Aprelevka. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Aprelevka is incorporated within Naro-Fominsky Municipal District as Aprelevka Urban Settlement.

column1: Aprelevka's most notable industry was the Soviet Union's largest plant producing vinyl discs
column2: which was founded in 1910 by three German businessmen: Gottlieb Moll
column4: and August Kybarth. There is also a chemical plant in the town.
